title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When opening a file that is already open in a different editor type, selecting 'Open With... / Default Text Editor' does not open a new editor for the file.
EB: Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content. Select test.xml in the Navigator and choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'. A new editor should open for the file, because the editor type is different.
SR:
1. Open the ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example.
2. Create a new basic project.
3. Create a new file named test.xml.
4. The editor used for test.xml is the scripted resource editor example, which ignores the XML file content.
5. In the Navigator, select test.xml.
6. Choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'.
7. Verify that a new editor opens for the file, using the default text editor, because the editor type is different.
